Description: Squat marl pottery jar with rounded body and base, two pierced tubular handles on the shoulder and flat ledge rim; decorated with large spirals in red paint, with wavy lines over and above handles and cross-hatching on the rim.
Curator's comments: Published: W. M. F. Petrie, Diospolis Parva: the cemeteries of Abadiyeh and Hu. Egypt Exploration Fund Memoir 20. (London 1901), pl. xv.D7c; reproduced as Decorated ware D34K in Petrie’s Corpus of Prehistoric Pottery (1921), pl. xxxiii.
